fr:mainmatter.fr:p:
Let (S 	riangleright P, \iota ^S, \sigma ^S, 	ext {pr}^S) and (T 	riangleright Q, \iota ^T, \sigma ^T, 	ext {pr}^T) be monad containers. A compatible composition of these is a pair of maps:
 egin {align*} \sigma &: \prod _{s : \lbrack 
egthinspace \lbrack T 	riangleright Q brack 
egthinspace brack \ S} (\Diamond ^{Q}_{P}\ s 	o \lbrack 
egthinspace \lbrack T 	riangleright Q brack 
egthinspace brack \ S) 	o \lbrack 
egthinspace \lbrack T 	riangleright Q brack 
egthinspace brack \ S\ 	ext {pr} &: \prod _{\{s : \lbrack 
egthinspace \lbrack T 	riangleright Q brack 
egthinspace brack \ S\}}\ \prod _{\{f : \Diamond ^{Q}_{P}\ s 	o \lbrack 
egthinspace \lbrack T 	riangleright Q brack 
egthinspace brack \ S\}} \Diamond ^{Q}_{P}\ (\sigma \ s\ f) 	o \sum _{p : \Diamond ^{Q}_{P}\ s} \Diamond ^{Q}_{P}\ (f\ p) \end {align*}
where:
(T 	riangleright Q \circ S 	riangleright P, (\iota ^T, \lambda \_ . \iota ^T), \sigma , 	ext {pr}) is a monad container.
The container morphisms \lambda \ t . (t , \lambda \_ . \iota ^S) 	riangleright \pi _1 and \lambda \ s . (\iota ^T , \lambda \_ . s) 	riangleright \pi _2 are both monad container morphisms.
The middle unitary laws hold:
 egin {align*} (t , f) &= \sigma \ (t , \lambda \_ . \iota ^S)\ (\lambda \ p . (\iota ^T , \lambda \_ . f\ (\pi _1\ p)))\ (q , p) &= (\pi _1\ (	ext {pr}_1\ (q , p)) , \pi _2\ (	ext {pr}_2\ (q , p))) \end {align*}
where (q , p) : \Diamond ^{Q}_{P}\ (t , f), and the second equality holds given the first one.

These are in bijection with the compatible compositions of the monad container extensions of the relevent monad containers, and thus are also in bijection with the relevent types of monad container distributive law.
Monad container distributive laws allow you to define a notion of composition for monad containers. They are in bijection with compatible compositions of monad containers.

Let (S \triangleright P, \iota ^S, \sigma ^S, \text {pr}^S) and (T \triangleright Q, \iota ^T, \sigma ^T, \text {pr}^T) be monad containers. A monad container morphism is a container morphism u \triangleright v : S \triangleright P \to T \triangleright Q such that:
\begin {align*} u\ \iota ^S &= \iota ^T\\ u\ (\sigma ^S\ s\ f) &= \sigma ^T\ (u\ s)\ (u \circ f \circ v)\\ \text {pr}^S_1\ (v\ q) &= v\ (\text {pr}^T_1\ q)\\ \text {pr}^S_2\ (v\ q) &= v\ (\text {pr}^T_2\ q) \end {align*}
These are in bijection with monad maps between the monad container extensions of the relevant monad containers.
This can be extended to a fully faithful functor from the category of monad containers and monad container maps to the category of \mathbf {Set}-monads and monad maps. [uustalu2017]
Monad container distributive laws allow you to define a notion of composition for monad containers. They are in bijection with compatible compositions of monad containers.
